issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: The nodemanager entries on the RM UI is not sortable unlike the other web pages.
fields.summary: [MR-279] Node entries on the RM UI are not sortable

comments.body: After applying this page, nodes listing table will be sortable like other pages. Please review this patch.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12492254/MAPREDUCE-2843.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 4 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    -1 findbugs.  The patch appears to introduce 5 new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed these unit tests:

                  org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.webapp.TestNodesPage

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

@Abhijit, the test still seems to be failing. Can you please take a look again?

Hi Mahadev,
I tried with newly setup environment as well.
But the test case is passing.

I executed the tests like following 
trunk\hadoop-mapreduce-project\hadoop-yarn\hadoop-yarn-server\hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager>*mvn install -P-cbuild -Dcommons.daemon.os.name=linux -Dcommons.daemon.os.arch=i686*

Following is the output from my tests execution.

Results :

Tests run: 48, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0

Can you try to run the same patch again?

Is there difference betweem the way i execute the tests and the way hudson does it?



Thanks & Regards,
Abhijit

Abhijit,
 Jenkins just runs mvn test (please see dev-support/test-patch.sh). Can you take a look at:
https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/677/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.webapp/TestNodesPage/testNodesBlockRender/

to see whats the issue with jenkins? Why do you need to pass -Dcommons.daemon.os.arch=i686?

Mahadev,

I am running the build on Windows 7 OS. 
But hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/pom.xml file has os support for linux & Mac OS.
Due to this my build was failing. 
So as a workaround i am passing those properties explicitly on the command line.

I tried with mvn test as well but still the testcase is passing.

I will try with linux.

Is it possible for you to also test this in your development environment?

Regards,
Abhijit
Reuploading the same patch to trigger the CI

Need to fix the failing testcase. Hence cancelling this patch

Hi Lu,
Thanks a lot for reviewing..i have added testcase with different logic.
The purpose is to make sure that the number of th cells must match the td cells in a row.


Thanks & Regards,
Abhijit

I was trying to write a more generic testcase to validate the generated table format. Thats why i added a custom validator which i thought could be improved later to test diferent issues with table structure. 

Anyways, i have added another patch which does exactly what you have suggested.
